text: Schoenobius retractalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1919. It is found in Guyana. The wingspan is 16 mm. The basal area of the forewings is white with a cupreous-brown costal edge. There is a patch of cupreous-brown suffusion and a black antemedial line. The medial area is cupreous brown with a white streak below the costa. The hindwings are silky white with a cupreous-brown terminal line.Annals and Magazine of Natural History (9) 3 (17): 451 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1919 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Schoenobius retractalis
